DataElement.preferredName: Patient Central Nervous System Disease or Disorder Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to eligibility criteria for a person who receives medical treatment having disease related to the brain and spinal cord.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Central Nervous System Disease or Disorder Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to eligibility criteria for person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment having disease related to the brain and spinal cord.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Central Nervous System Disease or Disorder Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: The main information-processing organs of the nervous system, consisting of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have a histo
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or evidence upon physical examination of CNS disease, including primary brain tumor, seizures not controlled with standard medical therapy, any brain metastases, or history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA, stroke), transient ischemic attack (TIA) or subarachnoid hemorrhage within six months of the first date of treatment on this study

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a nervous system disorder (paresthesia, peripheral motor neuropathy, or peripheral sensory neuropathy) >= grade 2, per the CTCAE v4.0?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or evidence upon physical examination of CNS disease, including primary brain tumor, seizures not controlled with standard medical therapy or any brain metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: A brain metastasis that is located <=5 mm of the optic chiasm or within the brainstem

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known brain metastases

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or evidence upon physical examination of CNS disease, including primary brain tumor, seizures which are not controlled with non-enzyme inducing anticonvulsants or any brain metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of CNS disease at study enrollment

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of seizure activity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or evidence upon physical examination of CNS disease, including primary brain tumor, any CNS metastases, or history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA, stroke), transient ischemic attack (TIA) or subarachnoid hemorrhage within 6 months of the first date of treatment on this study? (Patients with CNS metastases must be stable for >3 months after treatment and off steroid treatment prior to study enrollment.)

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prior history of CNS disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or evidence upon physical exam of central nervous system (CNS) disease, including primary brain tumor, seizures not controlled with standard medical therapy or any brain metastases or leptomeningeal disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRf Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: No known CNS metastases or neurological symptoms possibly related to active CNS metastasis

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or evidence upon physical examination of CNS disease, including primary brain tumor, seizures not controlled with non-enzyme inducing anticonvulsants, any brain metastases and/or epidural disease, or history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA, stroke), transient ischemic attack (TIA) or subarachnoid hemorrhage within six months prior to the first date of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or evidence upon physical examination of CNS disease, including brain tumor, seizures not controlled with standard medical therapy or any brain metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have symptomatic or untreated leptomeningeal or brain metastasis or spinal cord compression?

ReferenceDocuments.name: AECC Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has history of seizure disorder requiring antiepileptics and has had a seizure episode within the last 6 months

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known leptomeningeal or brain metastases or spinal cord compression?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Known central nervous system metastases

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have central nervous disease involvement?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of epilepsy or other major central nervous system disorder

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Known brain metastases (previously treated brain metastases, neurologically stable, and no ongoing or anticipated need for steroid therapy are eligible).

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known brain metastases or leptomeningeal metastases that does not meet the following conditions: metastases that have been treated and there is no MRI evidence of progression for at least 4 weeks after treatment is complete, no requirement for immunosuppressive doses of systemic corticosteroids (greater than 10 mg/day prednisone equivalents) for at least 2 weeks prior to study drug administration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has known brain metastases and/or carcinomatous meningitis.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known active CNS metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have CNS disease or other sites of extra-pulmonary metastases at the time of most recent episode of disease recurrence preceding enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known CNS metastasis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have no clinical signs or neurologic symptoms suggestive of CNS leukemia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1501 Question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a confirmed history of encephalitis, meningitis, or uncontrolled seizures within the year prior to signing informed consent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have recurrent, progressive or refractory diffuse intrinsic brain stem glioma (DIPG) or medulloblastoma or Atypical Teratoid Rhabdoid Tumor (ATRT)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have asymptomatic treated CNS disease

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Radiographic demonstration of improvement upon the completion of CNS directed therapy and no evidence of interim progression between the completion of CNS directed therapy and the screening radiographic study

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have symptomatic uncontrolled brain metastases

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to indicated level from nervous system disorders that resulted from prior therapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has known brain metastases and/or carcinomatous meningitis

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of seizure activity or a known condition that may pre- dispose to seizure activity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have asymptomatic treated CNS metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAE161
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known untreated or symptomatic CNS metastasis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CE7
ReferenceDocuments.description: The patients largest brain metastasis measures less than 2.5 cm in maximal diameter, and the total tumour volume is less than or equal to 30cm3

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history or evidence upon physical examination of CNS disease, including primary brain tumor, seizures which are not controlled with non-enzyme inducing anticonvulsants, and/or epidural disease, or history of cerebrovascular accident (CVA, stroke), transient ischemic attack (TIA) or subarachnoid hemorrhage within 6 months prior to the first date of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: If yes, Are they stable (without evidence of progression by imaging using the identical imaging modality for each assessment, either magnetic resonance imaging [MRI] or computed tomography [CT] scan), for at least 4 weeks prior to study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a nervous system disorder (paresthesia, peripheral motor neuropathy, or peripheral sensory neuropathy) greater than or equal to grade 2, per the CTCAE v5.0?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Untreated imminent or established spinal cord compression, treated with standard of care?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have brain metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have history of seizure disorder?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Known Central Nervous System Metastases

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text29
ReferenceDocuments.description: CNS metastasis

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have untreated brain metastases, spinal cord compression, or evidence of symptomatic brain metastases or leptomeningeal disease as noted on CT or MRI scans?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have current symptoms from brain metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: FSRT target is at least 0.5 cm from the optic chiasm and brainstem

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_Text_23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have a history of CNS2 or CNS3 prior to disease confirmation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have brain tumors?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known brain metastases or leptomeningeal disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of CNS metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Untreated spinal cord compression or evidence of spinal metastases with a risk of impending fracture or spinal cord compression?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been treated for brain metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient CNS1, CNS2 or CNS3 disease without clinical signs or neurologic symptoms suggestive of CNS leukemia, such at facial nerve palsy, brain or eye involvement or hypothalamic syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Evidence of symptomatic CNS disease.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known, untreated CNS metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient recovered to indicated level from nervous system disorders that resulted from prior therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a baseline neurological disorder with manifestations that overlap with vincristine-associated neurotoxicities?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been treated for brain metastasis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have treated brain metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patients have CNS1 or CNS2 status and no clinical signs or neurologic symptoms suggestive of CNS leukemia, such as cranial palsy?
